segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is getting bigger, and she’s just standing in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on getting those cookies that they don’t notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the woman; she’s going to have a big cleanup on her hands.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool looks like he’s about to fall any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm and tidy, unlike the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this scene is a mix of innocence and impending trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation makes me feel a little sorry for everyone involved.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt in all this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
